meanings.sent1: The dissimilatory process helps us understand how things are different from each other.
meanings.sent2: Her dissimilatory approach to problem-solving always leads to unique solutions.
meanings.sent3: The dissimilatory way he organized his room made it look like a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The dissimilatory nature of the two siblings was evident in their contrasting personalities.
meanings.sent5: The dissimilatory colors of the flowers in the garden created a beautiful contrast.

meanings.definition: Capable of or involved in dissimilation.
meanings.sent1: The dissimilatory bacteria play a crucial role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The dissimilatory organisms adapt to changing environments more effectively.
meanings.sent3: It was dissimilatory how quickly he switched between different tasks.
meanings.sent4: Her dissimilatory skills in art allowed her to create diverse masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The dissimilatory behavior of the chameleon amazed the observers.
